Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class holds information about everything in the current state of the game. The position on the board, whose turn it is, what positions have already occurred, and the like. All chess game logic occurs through the Board class and its member methods. In order to move a piece, movePiece() should be called and its exceptions checked. ChessExceptions should be checked and handled as necessary. Following a movePiece() call, checkConditions() must also be called in order to update the boards check and stalemate flags. The Board's coordinate system is in (x, y), where x indicates the horizontal location of the square, starting from the left. y indicates the vertical location of the square, starting from the bottom, i.e. the white side. Note that this is different from the coordinate system of ChessPanel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Board.CheckmateException
      A CheckmateException does not indicate an error, but rather is used to signal to the containing ChessPanel that a checkmate has occurred and needs to be handled.
      class  Board.ChessException
      A ChessException is any chess game-related exception.
      class  Board.IllegalMoveException
      An IllegalMoveException is thrown whenever a move is illegal, for example moving a pawn three squares forward.
      class  Board.IsNotYourTurnException
      An IsNotYourTurnException is thrown whenever a move is made for the wrong colour, e.g.
      class  Board.NeedToPromotePawnException
      A NeedToPromotePawnException does not indicate an error, but rather is used to signal the containing ChessPanel that a promotion needs to occur.
      class  Board.StalemateException
      A Stalemate Exception does not indicate an error, but rather is used to signal the containing ChessPanel that a stalemate has occurred.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        Board()
        This is the default constructor for the Board class. This sets the values of the board, by putting pieces in their proper default locations.

      • Board

        Board(Piece[][] currentBoard)
        Additional constructor for the Board. It accepts a board and sets the board of the class to the accepted board.
        Parameters:
        currentBoard - The accepted board that the board of this class will be set to.

    • Method Detail

      • allValidMoves

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> allValidMoves(Piece piece,
                                                     int[] location)
        This method accepts a piece and its location. It will then proceed to analyze the board and determine which squares the piece can move onto. Then return an ArrayList of valid locations relative to the piece. This method is run every time the user tries to move a piece.
        Parameters:
        piece - This is the type of piece that is being moved.
        location - This is an array of length 2 representing the X and Y coordinates of the piece the user is trying to move.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of arrays of length 2. These array are the X and Y differences between the piece we are moving and the possible target square. These coordinates are all relative to the piece we are moving.

      • checkConditions

        void checkConditions()
               throws Board.StalemateException,
                      Board.CheckmateException
        This method analyzes the board to see if any endgame conditions have occurred. It checks for check, mate, and stalemate. This method is run after every move.
        Throws:
        Board.StalemateException
        Board.CheckmateException

      • promotePawn

        public void promotePawn(int[] prevLocation,
               Piece newPiece)
                 throws Board.IllegalMoveException,
                        Board.IsNotYourTurnException
        Method to perform pawn promotion. The method also validates the promotion and will throw exceptions as necessary if the promotion does not validate.
        Parameters:
        prevLocation - The current location of the pawn to be promoted.
        newPiece - The Piece to promote the pawn into.
        Throws:
        Board.IllegalMoveException - If the pawn being promoted does not exist or otherwise should not be promoted.
        Board.IsNotYourTurnException - If the pawn being promoted is the wrong colour or is being promoted into the wrong colour.

      • findKing

        int[] findKing(boolean colour)
        Returns an array of length 2 with the coordinates of the king given my the parameter.
        Parameters:
        colour - Boolean for which king you want to find. True is white, false is black.
        Returns:
        Returns the location of the king, which is saved in a variable.

        public Piece[][] getBoard()
        Getter that returns the board as a 2-Dimensional array of pieces.
        Returns:

      • getPawnLocation

        public int getPawnLocation(boolean colour)
        This is a necessary method for the column in which a promoting pawn is located. The parameter determines the colour of the variable you want.
        Parameters:
        colour - True is white and false is black.
        Returns:
        Returns the appropriate variable saved in this class.

      • movePiece

        Piece movePiece(int[] location,
              int[] destination)
          throws Board.ChessException
        This method is run after the move has been selected. It will undergo the procedure of actually moving the piece. It accepts the coordinates of the location from and to where the piece is moving. It returns the type of piece that is being moved so that the panel can draw it correctly. This method also is responsible for raising and lowering flags responsible for en passant and castling.
        Parameters:
        location - An array of length 2, representing the coordinates of where the piece was, prior to being moved.
        destination - An array of length 2, representing where the piece will end up, after being moved.
        Returns:
        Returns the type of piece that was being moved.
        Throws:
        Board.IsNotYourTurnException - This is an exception used for testing. It will never actually occur in a game. It occurs when the variable keeping track of who's turn it is will state that it is not the turn of the player to whom belongs the piece located on the square from which the piece is being moved.
        Board.IllegalMoveException - This is an exception used for testing. It will never actually occur in a game. It occurs when one tries to move a piece to a location that the piece is not allowed to move to.
        Board.ChessException

      • safe

        boolean safe(int[] location,
           boolean colour)
        This method figures out whether a certain square is safe for a certain colour. Safe means that there is not a single enemy piece that can capture a piece on the square in one move.
        Parameters:
        location - An array of length 2 that represents the coordinates of the square that needs to be checked.
        colour - The colour of pieces that the square is or isn't safe for. True is white and false is black.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value that is true if the square was safe for that colour.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        A getter for the current turn. Every move counts as 1 turn. So in one normal chess turn, where both players have gone once, this variable will have increased by 2.
        Returns:
        The turn variable.

      • getIsWhitesTurn

        public boolean getIsWhitesTurn()
        A method that returns whether it is currently white's turn.
        Returns:
        Returns a variable keeping track of this.
